version_description:
– All books correctly appear in My Books after checking them out
– Users no longer encounter rare situations where logging out not possible under certain network conditions
– Buttons no longer occasionally flash while the catalog is loading
– Minor bug fixes and performance improvements

– Fixed an issue where turning to a new chapter could result in a blank page
– Other minor bug fixes and improvements

- New Logo
- Support for other libraries
- Offers a new collection of ebooks called SimplyE, which users can access without a library card.
- Several enhancements have also been added to make reading an ebook easier.

Thank you for using SimplyE. We make periodic updates to our app to ensure quicker and easier access to books and information—anywhere, anytime.

What’s New in SimplyE 2.0.0
- New users can now apply for a library card with e-book borrowing privileges through the app.
- Users can download and keep free e-books from the new SimplyE collection of classics and more—with or without a library card.
- In addition to The New York Public Library, other libraries' e-book collections can be made available to their patrons through the app.

SimplyE 2.0.1
- Fixed an issue with crashing on iPads with larger font sizes.

– Fixed an issue with reader performance
– Improved organization of FAQ help articles

We have addressed some issues that may have caused the app to crash when launched, or while signing in.
If you continue to have problems downloading books, please try signing out and then sign in again.

We value your support of SimplyE and its libraries!
Do not hesitate to visit our Support Page with questions and feedback.

2.0.4 corrects the support email for Brooklyn Public Library.

We have addressed some issues that may have caused the app to crash when launched, or while signing in.
If you continue to have problems downloading books, please try signing out and then sign in again.

We value your support of SimplyE and its libraries!
Do not hesitate to visit our Support Page with questions and feedback.

We've found the source of a crash that may occur when a user attempts to download a book.

This update improves stability for:
- Downloading books
- Returning books

If you continue to experience problems, please try:
- Tap on Settings, then Accounts
- Choose your library
- Sign out, then sign back in

We appreciate your continuing support of SimplyE! If you have any issues with books or signing in, please do not hesitate to contact our support team.

This update contains the following:

- Support for iOS 11
- Stability improvements; bug fixes
- Updated layout on the book description pages
- 3D touch support

iPad Users:
- Split View support
- True Tone support
- 10.5" screen

We have fixed an issue that would cause your books to lose their bookmarked location.

We appreciate your continuing support of SimplyE! If you have any issues, please do not hesitate to contact our support team.

This update also contains:
- Fix for users having trouble signing out
- Fix for a crash that could occur while reading a book
- Improvements to Dynamic Type support
- Layout fixes

You can once again reliabily visit the FAQ and Support pages.

We appreciate your continuing support of SimplyE and its libraries! Please do not hesitate to contact our support team with any issues.

In this stability update, we have:
Improved the reliability of bookmarking your reading position between sessions.
Reduced the number of crashes you may experience while using the app.
Fixed some layout issues for certain iPhone users.

You now have a copy of your library card barcode in Settings to use at your local branch.

If you continue to have issues with your reading experience, please do not hesitate to contact our support team from inside the app.

SimplyE Sync: With your permission, your bookmarks and reading position are now saved to the cloud and synced to your other devices.

We have also addressed several issues in this release:
- See where you are in the queue for a book you've reserved
- Stability improvements, fewer crashes
- Small visual updates to the reading experience

We also happily welcome to the SimplyE family seven new library systems:
- Butte County Library
- Calvert Library
- Charles County Public Library
- Frederick County Public Libraries
- Howard County Library System
- Montgomery County Public Libraries
- St. Mary's County Library

If you have any issues with your SimplyE experience, please do not hesitate to contact our support within the app. Thank you for reading with us!

– We unintentionally removed the “time remaining” icon to let you know when your loan expires. This has been returned.
– You can now tap on the details of a book to see a better estimate of when your reservation will be available.

We're working to bring more features and stability to your reading experience. Please continue providing feedback to our support team from inside the app.

—The SimplyE Team at The New York Public Library

This update contains several improvements, and is recommended for all SimplyE users.

- Bookmark Sync improvements
- More reliable page turning
- Improved general stability and fewer crashes

If you have any issue reading a particular book, please do not hesitate to contact SimplyE support.

In this release, we've made improvements to performance and stability.
If you have any issues with your reading experience, please do not hesitate to contact our support inside the app.

Thank you for being a patron of SimplyE.
New libraries from the Califa Group are now available.
We've fixed a bug that would mistakenly show books on reserve as being available to check out.

– Fixed an issue where audiobooks and PDFs would incorrectly appear in My Books
– Fixed an error in displaying the queue position of a book on reserve

If you continue to experience problems downloading books or navigating the book catalog, please to do hesitate to contact our support team. Thank you for supporting SimplyE.

– Fixed an issue with the OpenDyslexic font
– Fixed an issue that would cause the app to freeze when opening a book
– Added libraries from the Yavapai Library Network
- Fixed a crash that may occur when trying to sign in.

The SimplyE Collection has been updated with new categories.
More libraries now support SimplyE Sync.
San José Public Library is now available.

Thank you for your continued support of SimplyE. If you have any issues, please do not hesitate to contact our in-app support team.
In this update:
- Fixed a crash that would sometimes occur when browsing the catalog
- A few other rare crashes have been addressed
– Various bug fixes and improvements
– New library additions
– Introducing Audiobooks from supporting libraries
– Improvements to Audiobook playback; accessibility adjustments

– Changing the font size should no longer lose your current reading location
– Addressed an issue that would cause the app to freeze if left alone for some time
– Adjustment for dynamic text size legibility

Bug Fix:
If you use more than one library account in SimplyE, and your list of book loans does not look correct for the current library, you may need to sign out and sign back in. Please contact us if you need assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Previously:
– Changing the font size should no longer lose your current reading location
– Addressed an issue that would cause the app to freeze if left alone for some time
– Adjustment for dynamic text size legibility
- We've addressed an issue that would cause a book to lose its place. If you continue to have issues, please give us feedback at gethelp@nypl.org. Thank you for your support.
– Addressed an issue that may occur when leaving the app while reading a book

– Small improvements to Audiobook Playback.
– Fixed a rare crash when leaving the app, and returning later.

- Fixed Software Licences page not displaying
- Filtered inaccessible content from catalog
- Updated library catalogs

- PDFs now marked as read after opening book
- PDFs now returned properly
- New production libraries are now populated dynamically
- Fixed a crashing bug introduced in 3.2.0

We've heard you. This version, enjoy a faster startup and login. You can also see new libraries the moment they're available rather than having to wait for a new release.

We've also added new notifications to keep you updated on when a book you've had on hold becomes available.

- Fixed "Add Library" button sometimes remaining disabled until switching screens under settings
- Fixed PDF reader getting broken for iOS 13

- Fixed iOS13 default modal view changes
- Fixed iOS13 dark mode visual bugs
- Fixed some error handling logic that wasn't presenting properly

- Fixed audiobook player UI being "squished"
- Input fields for account details now use library-specified values
- Improved login process
Legal pages display update.

- Fixed warnings and addressed some bugs.
- Upgraded our debugging software.
- Layout fixes.
Changes to improve catalog responsiveness

- Fix Santa Clara County Library login issue
- Fix crash when opening audiobooks on older iOS versions
- More localization improvements

- Resolved welcome screen, catalog and other crashes
- Fixed an issue where patrons would lose their account information
- Fixed barcode display error
- Fixed login issue
- Fixed several other bugs

- Improved audiobook support
- Improvements to NYPL card creator
- Bug fixes
- Fix for ebook download bug
This release fixes several different bugs that were causing crashes, account login errors and audiobook play issues. We have also updated the barcode scanner.
